laboratory_examinations.findings: 1.3 mg/dL (115 μmol/L); higher than the previous level of 0.8 mg/dL (71 μmol/L) obtained 1 year earlier.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Increased to 1.8 mg/dL (159 μmol/L) on hospital day 3 and further increased to 6.9 mg/dL (610 μmol/L) by hospital day 9, then decreased to 3.6 mg/dL after initiation of hemodialysis on hospital day 15.

laboratory_examinations.findings: 17 mg/dL (reference range: 8-25 mg/dL); increased to 111 mg/dL (39.6 mmol/L) on hospital day 3 and reached 109 mg/dL (38.6 mmol/L) on hospital day 9.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Increased to 111 mg/dL on hospital day 9, then slightly decreased to 108 mg/dL by hospital day 15.

laboratory_examinations.findings: 39.8% on admission; decreased to 27.9% on hospital day 9 and further decreased to 26.3% on hospital day 15.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Decreased from 39.8% at admission to 27.9% on hospital day 9 and to 26.3% on hospital day 15.

laboratory_examinations.findings: 12.4 g/dL on admission; decreased to 8.6 g/dL on hospital day 9 and further decreased to 8.0 g/dL on hospital day 15.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Decreased from 12.4 g/dL at admission to 8.6 g/dL on hospital day 9 and to 8.0 g/dL on hospital day 15.
